revisions.rev:
[[File:Flags-of-Vancouver-Canada-BC.jpg|thumb|right|The flags of [[Vancouver]], [[Canada]], and [[British Columbia]]; the Canadian flag takes place of precedence in the centre]] [[File:Terry Fox Memorial 2008.jpg|thumb|right|The [[Flag of Canada|Canadian national flag]] flying next to a statue of [[Terry Fox]]]] This is a list of '''flags used in Canada'''. The [[Department of Canadian Heritage]] lays out protocol guidelines for the display of flags, including an order of precedence; these instructions are only conventional, however, and are generally intended to show respect for what are considered important symbols of the state or institutions.{{Cite web| url=http://www.pch.gc.ca/pgm/ceem-cced/etiqtt/index-eng.cfm| last=Department of Canadian Heritage| authorlink=Department of Canadian Heritage| title=Ceremonial and Canadian Symbols Promotion > Flag Etiquette in Canada| publisher=Queen's Printer for Canada| accessdate=18 September 2010}} The [[Queen's Personal Canadian Flag|Queen's personal standard]] is supreme in the order of precedence, followed by those for the monarch's representatives (depending on jurisdiction), the personal flags of other members of the [[Monarchy of Canada#Canadian Royal Family|Royal Family]],{{Cite web| url=http://www.pch.gc.ca/pgm/ceem-cced/etiqtt/102-eng.cfm| last=Department of Canadian Heritage| authorlink=Department of Canadian Heritage| title=Ceremonial and Canadian Symbols Promotion > Personal Flags and Standards| publisher=Queen's Printer for Canada| accessdate=18 September 2010}} and then the [[Flag of Canada|national flag]] and provincial flags. ==Royal== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:white; border: 1px #6082B6 solid; border-collapse: collapse; width:100%" |- bgcolor="#A9A9A9" ! width="15%" align="left"| Flag !! width="10%" align="left"| Date !! width="30%" align="left"| Name !! width="45%" align="left"| Description |- | [[File:Royal Standard of Canada.svg|100px|border]] || 1962âpresent || [[Queen's Personal Canadian Flag|Royal Standard of Canada]] || A banner of the [[Arms of Canada|Royal Arms of Canada]] defaced with a [[royal cypher]] of Queen [[Elizabeth II]] |- | [[File:Personal Flag of the Prince of Wales for use in Canada.svg|100px|border]] || 2011âpresent || [[Prince of Wales' Personal Canadian Flag|Royal Standard of Prince Charles]] || A banner of the [[Arms of Canada|Royal Arms of Canada]] defaced with the [[Prince of Wales's feathers]] and a 3-point label |- | [[File:Personal Flag of the Duke of Cambridge for use in Canada.svg|100px|border]] || 2011âpresent || [[Duke of Cambridge's Personal Canadian Flag|Royal Standard of Prince William]] || A banner of the [[Arms of Canada|Royal Arms of Canada]] defaced with the [[royal cypher]] of [[Prince William, Duke of Cambridge]], and a 3-point label with one red scallop, representing the coat of arms of his mother, [[Diana, Princess of Wales]] |} ==Viceregal and administrative== ===Governor general=== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:white; border: 1px #6082B6 solid; border-collapse: collapse; width:100%" |- bgcolor="#A9A9A9" ! width="15%" align="left"| Flag !! width="10%" align="left"| Date !! width="30%" align="left"| Name !! width="45%" align="left"| Description |- | [[File:Flag of the Governor-General of Canada.svg|100px]] || 1981â1999
2002âpresent || [[Flag of the Governor General of Canada|Standard of the Governor General of Canada]] || A blue field with the [[Crest (heraldry)|crest]] of the [[Arms of Canada|Royal Arms of Canada]] charged in the centre |} ===Lieutenant governors=== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:white; border: 1px #6082B6 solid; border-collapse: collapse; width:100%" |- bgcolor="#A9A9A9" ! width="15%" align="left"| Flag !! width="10%" align="left"| Date !! width="30%" align="left"| Name !! width="45%" align="left"| Description |- | Ontario]], ensigned with a [[St Edward's Crown|St. Edward's Crown]] and surrounded a wreath of by ten golden maple leaves, charged in the centre |- | [[File:Flag of the Lieutenant-Governor of Quebec.svg|100px]] || 1950âpresent || Standard of the [[Lieutenant Governor of Quebec]] || A blue field with the shield of the [[coat of arms of Quebec]], ensigned with a [[Tudor Crown]] and within a white disc, charged in the centre |- | [[File:Flag of the Lieutenant-Governor of Nova Scotia.svg|100px]] || 1929âpresent || Standard of the [[Lieutenant Governor of Nova Scotia]] || The Royal Brunswick.svg|100px]] || 1982âpresent || Standard of the [[Lieutenant Governor of New Brunswick]] || A blue field with the shield of the [[coat of arms of New Brunswick]], ensigned with a [[St Edward's Crown|St. Edward's Crown]] and surrounded by a wreath of ten golden maple leaves, charged in the centre |- | [[File:Flag of the Lieutenant-Governor of Manitoba.svg|100px]] || 1984âpresent (unofficial)=== {{Expand list|date=September 2010}} {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:white; border: 1px #6082B6 solid; border-collapse: collapse; || A field tierced per pale, blue, white, and red, with a gold star in the upper hoist |- | [[File:Flag of Saguenay-Lac-Saint-Jean.svg|100px]] || 1938âpresent || Flag of [[Saguenay-Lac-Saint-Jean]] || A field party per fess, green and yellow, with a red-bordered grey ordinary cross; green represents the region's forests, yellow its agriculture, grey its industry and commerce, and red the vitality of the population |- | [[File:Flag of Labrador.svg|100px]] || 1974âpresent || [[Flag of Labrador]] || A field party per fess, white and azure, with a green horizontal band across the centre and a spruce twig in the upper hoist |} ==Military and police== ===Canadian Forces=== {{Expand list|date=September 2010}} {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:white; border: 1px #6082B6 solid; border-collapse: collapse; width:100%" |- bgcolor="#A9A9A9" ! width="15%" align="left"| Flag !! width="10%" align="left"| Date !! width="30%" align="left"| Name !! width="45%" align="left"| Description |- | [[File:Canadian Forces Flag.svg|100px]] || 1968âpresent || Flag of the [[Canadian Forces]] || A white field with the [[National Flag of Canada]] in the [[Flag terminology#Description of standard flag parts and terms|canton]] and the Canadian Forces [[badge]] charged in the fly |- | [[File:Naval Jack of Canada.svg|100px]] || 1968âpresent || [[Canadian Forces Naval Jack]] || A white field with the National Flag of Canada in the canton and the [[Royal Canadian Navy]] badge in blue charged in the fly |- | [[File:Naval Auxiliary Jack of Canada.svg|100px]] || 1968âpresent || Canadian Forces Auxiliary Jack || A blue field with the National Flag of Canada in the canton and the Royal Canadian Navy badge in white charged in the fly |- | [[File:Canadian Army Flag.svg|100px]] || 1968âpresent || Flag of the [[Canadian Army]] || A white field with the National Flag of Canada in the canton and the Canadian Army badge charged in the fly |- | [[File:Royal Canadian Air Force ensign.svg|100px]] || 1965âpresent || Flag of the [[Royal Canadian Air Force]] || A field of air force blue with the National Flag of Canada in the canton and the Royal Canadian Air Force [[roundel]] charged in the fly |- | [[File:Flag of the Canadian Navy Board.svg|100px]] || c. 1964âpresent || Flag of the [[Canadian Navy Board]] || A field [[Division of the field|party per bend]], blue and [[Sanguine (heraldry)|sanguine]], with a fouled anchor in gold charged in the centre |- | [[File:Flag of the Royal Military College of Canada.svg|100px]] || 1920âpresent || Flag of the [[Royal Military College of Canada]] || A field tierced per pale, red, white, and red with the badge of the Royal Military College of Canada charged in the centre |- | [[File:Canada Commander in Chief Unit Banner.svg|100px]] || 2000âpresent || Banner of the [[List of awards presented by the Governor General of Canada|Commander-in-Chief Unit Commendation]] || A field tierced per pale, blue, red, and azure, with the crest of the Royal Arms of Canada charged in the centre |} ===Coast Guard=== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:white; border: 1px #6082B6 solid; border-collapse: collapse; width:100%" |- bgcolor="#A9A9A9" ! width="15%" align="left"| Flag !! width="10%" align="left"| Date !! width="30%" align="left"| Name !! width="45%" align="left"| Description |- | [[File:Coastguard Flag of Canada.svg|border|100px]] || 1962âpresent || Flag of the [[Canadian Coast Guard]] || A banner of the arms of the Canadian Coast Guard: vertical diband of white and blue, a red maple leaf emlem charged in the hoist and a pair of fish in gold and facing opposite directions charged in the fly |} ==Municipal== {{Expand list|date=September 2010}} {{Split section||Talk:List of Canadian flags#Municipal flags|date=September 2010}} {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:white; border: 1px #6082B6 solid; border-collapse: collapse; width:100%" |- bgcolor="#A9A9A9" ! width="15%" align="left"| Flag !! width="10%" align="left"| Date !! width="30%" align="left"| Name !! width="45%" align="left"| Description |- | [[File:Flag of Montreal.svg|border|100px]] || 1939âpresent || [[Flag of Montreal]] || A white field with a red ordinary cross, a blue [[fleur-de-lis]], a [[Red Rose of Lancaster|Lancastrian rose]], a [[thistle]], and a [[shamrock]], all proper, in each quadrant |- | [[File:Flag of Winnipeg.svg|100px]] || 1975âpresent || [[Flag of Winnipeg]] || The blue represents Winnipeg's clear blue sky, and the gold a field of wheat surrounding the city's coat of arms |- | [[File:Flag of Calgary, Alberta.svg|100px]] || 1983âpresent || [[Flag of Calgary]] || A red field with white border at top and bottom, a combined 'C' and [[cowboy hat]] emblem in the hoist |- | [[File:Flag of Vancouver (Canada).svg|border|100px]] || 1983âpresent || [[Flag of Vancouver]] || The axe and paddle stand for the traditional industries, [[logging]] and [[fishing]], and the green background is a symbol of the forests |- | [[File:Flag of Quebec City.svg|100px]] || 1987âpresent || [[Flag of Quebec City]] || The ship represents [[Samuel de Champlain]]'s [[Don de Dieu (ship)]] and the background the city walls |- | [[File:Flag of Regina.svg|100px]] || 1992âpresent || Flag of [[Regina, Saskatchewan]] || |- | [[File:Flag of Cornwall, Ontario.svg|100px]] || 1995âpresent || [[Flag of Cornwall, Ontario|Flag of Cornwall]] || A vertical bicolour triband of gold, black, gold with the shield of the [[Duke of Cornwall#Arms|coat of arms of the Duke of Cornwall]] charged in the Canadian pale |- | [[File:Flag of Burlington, ON.png|100px]] || 1999âpresent || [[Flag of Burlington, Ontario|Flag of Burlington]] || A vertical bicolour triband of blue, yellow, blue with the shield of the coat of arms of [[Burlington, Ontario|Burlington]] charged in the Canadian pale |- | [[File:Toronto Flag.svg|100px]] || 1999âpresent || [[Flag of Toronto]] || A blue field with a white styleised city hall and maple leaf emblem |- | [[File:Flag of Ottawa, Ontario.svg|100px]] || 2000âpresent || [[Flag of Ottawa]] || A field party per pale enarched, blue and azure, with a stylised 'O' emblem charged in the centre |- | [[File:Flag of Hamilton.svg|100px]] || 2003âpresent || [[Flag of Hamilton, Ontario|Flag of Hamilton]] || A vertical bicolour triband of gold, blue, gold with a [[Charge (heraldry)#Plants|cinquefoil]] surrounded by a chain, all gold, charged in the [[Canadian pale]] |- | [[File:Flag of Metropolitan Toronto.svg|100px]] || 1954â1997 || Flag of [[Metro Toronto]] || A horizontal bi-colour band of green and blue with a white ringed symbol from the seal of Metro Toronto; the six rings represented Metro Toronto's six constituent lower-tier municipalities: [[Etobicoke]], [[York, Ontario|York]], [[North York]], [[East York]], [[Scarborough, Ontario|Scarborough]] and the former city of [[Old Toronto|Toronto]] |- | [[File:Flag of Lethbridge.svg|100px]] || 1967–present || Flag of [[Lethbridge]] || Red and white striped, with blue and white pattern in top left corner. |} ==Crown corporations== {{Expand list|date=September 2010}} {| border="2" [[Iroquois]] Confederacy || A [[mauve]] field party per fess by a band of white squares joined and a stylized white "Tree of Peace" charged in the centre; design is adapted from the [[Hiawatha]] [[wampum]] belt, each element represents an original nation in the confederacy |- | [[File:Flag of Eel Ground First Nation.svg|100px]] || Mid-1980s-present || Flag of the Natuaqanek Band || A red field with yellow left and right borders, a quartered [[roundel]] charged in the centre{{Cite web| url=http://flagspot.net/flags/ca_micmc.html| title=Canada > Index of Pages > First Nations > Mikmaq| publisher=Flags of the World| issn=1712-9842| accessdate=20 September 2010}} |- | [[File:Bandera Nis'ga Nation.png|100px]] || 2001âpresent || Flag of the [[Nisga'a]] || A vertical tricolour triband Register of Arms, Flags and Badges of Canada > Nisga'a Nation| publisher=Queen's Printer for Canada| accessdate=20 September 2010}} surrounded by black and sanguine ovals, charged in the [[Canadian pale]]{{Cite web| url=http://flagspot.net/flags/ca_nisga.html| title=Canada > Index of Pages > First Nations > Nisga'a Nation| publisher=Flags of the World| issn=1712-9842| accessdate=20 September 2010}} |- | [[File:Nunatsiavut flag.svg|100px]] || 2005âpresent || [[Flag of Nunatsiavut]] || A white field with a white, green, and blue [[Inukshuk]] charged in the centre |- | [[File:Haida flag.png|100px]] || ''Unknown''âpresent || Flag of the [[Haida people|Haida]] Nation || A red field with an eagle and raven headed bird, surrounded by a circlet, charged in the centre |- | [[File:Matimekush Lac John Band (Innu-Montagnais Nation), Quebec.gif|100px]] || ''Unknown''-present || Flag of the [[Innu|Matimekush Band]] || A vertical tricolour triband of [[Chartreuse (color)|chartreuse]], white, green with the coat of arms of the Matimekush Lac John Band charged in the Canadian pale |- | [[File:Mikmaq State Flag.svg|100px]] || ''Unknown''âpresent || Flag of the [[Mi'kmaq people|Mi'kmaq]] Nation Grand Council || A white field with a red [[Nordic Cross flag|Nordic cross]] and a red star and moon in the left quadrants; white denotes purity of creation, the red cross represents mankind and infinity, the sun and moon the forces of day and night |} ==Francophone peoples== {{See also|Flags of French-speaking people of North America}} {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:white; border: 1px #6082B6 solid; border-collapse: collapse; width:100%" |- bgcolor="#A9A9A9" ! width="15%" align="left"| Flag !! width="10%" align="left"| Date !! width="30%" align="left"| Name !! width="45%" align="left"| Description |- | [[File:Franco-Ontarian flag.svg|100px]] || 1975âpresent || Flag of the [[Franco-Ontarian]]s || A field party per fess, green and white, with a white fleur-de-lys charged in the hoist and a green trillium emblem charged in the fly |- | [[File:Bandera dels Fransaskois.svg|100px]] || 1976âpresent || Flag of the [[Fransaskois]] || A yellow field with a green Nordic cross centred towards the upper hoist and a red fleur-de-lis charged in the lower fly |- | [[File:Flag of the Franco-Manitobains.svg|100px]] || 1980âpresent || Flag of the [[Franco-Manitobains]] || A white field with yellow over sanguine bars with a green plant emblem in four pieces charged in the hoist |- | [[File:Flag of the Franco-Colombiens.svg|100px]] || 1981âpresent || Flag of the [[Franco-Columbian]]s || A white field party per pale by a bar gemelles and dancetty, a fleur-de-lys and [[Pacific Dogwood]] emblem charged in the fly; Dogwood is the [[Symbols of British Columbia|floral emblem of British Columbia]], the blue stripes evoke the [[Pacific Ocean]] and the rising mountains beside, the yellow centre of the Dogwood flower represents the sun |- | [[File:Flag of the Franco Albertains.svg|100px]] || 1982âpresent || [[Franco-Albertan Flag|Flag of the Franco-Albertans]] || A field party per bend sinister, blue and white, by a bend cotised white and blue with a white fleur-de-lys in the upper hoist and a red [[wild rose]] in the lower fly |- | [[File:Flag of the Franco-Yukonnais.svg|100px]] || 1985âpresent || Flag of the [[Franco-Yukonnais]] || A blue field and three diagonal stripes set from lower hoist to upper fly. The colours of the stripes are white and golden yellow. The effect created by the arrangement of the stripes is meant to represent [[Yukon]]'s many mountains. Blue is for the French people and the sky. White is for winter and snow. Yellow represents the [[gold rush]] and the Franco-Yukonnais contributions to history of the territory. |- | [[File:Franco-Terreneuviens.svg|100px]] || 1986âpresent || Flag of the FÃ©dÃ©ration des Francophones de Terre-Neuve et du Labrador (Franco-Terreneuviens) || Three unequal panels of blue, white, and red, with two yellow sails set on the line between the white and red panels. The sail on top is charged with a [[spruce]] twig, while the bottom sail is charged with a [[pitcher plant|pitcher flower]]. |- | [[File:Flag of the FrancoTenois.svg|100px]] || 1992âpresent || Flag of the [[Franco-TÃ©nois]] || A polar bear on a snowy hill, looking forward towards a snowflake/Fleur-de-lis combined, representing the French community of the [[Northwest Territories]] of Canada. |- | [[File:Flag of the Franco-Nunavois.png|100px]] || 2002âpresent || Flag of the [[Franco-Nunavois]] || Blue that represents the Arctic sky and white recalls the snow, abundantly present on the territory. The principal shape represent an [[igloo]], and under this one, the [[inukshuk]] which symbolise the human presence. A single [[dandelion]] flower grows from beneath it. |} ==Historical flags== ===National flags=== {{Expand list|date=September 2010}} {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse;" |- bgcolor="#efefef" ! width="110"|Flag!!width="100"|Date!!width="250"|Use!!width="250"|Description |- | [[File:Canadian Red Ensign.svg|100px]] || 1957â1965 || [[Canadian Red Ensign]], used as the ''[[de facto]]'' National Flag of Canada; unofficial. || [[Red Ensign]] defaced with the [[Royal Arms of Canada]]. The maple leaves at the bottom of the shield are red. |-b g b | [[File:Flag of Canada 1921.svg|100px]] || 1922â1957 || [[Canadian Red Ensign]], used as the ''[[de facto]]'' National Flag of Canada; unofficial. || [[Red Ensign]] defaced with the [[Royal Arms of Canada]]. The maple leaves at the bottom of the shield are green. |- | [[File:Flag of Canada-1868-Red.svg|100px]] || 1868â1922 || Used as the ''[[de facto]]'' National Flag of Canada; unofficial. || Red Ensign defaced with the arms of the four original provinces of Canada |- | [[File:Flag of the United Kingdom.svg|100px]] || 1801â1965 || Canada's ''[[de jure]]'' flag until 1965(when the current national was adopted), known as the Royal Union Flag || The [[Union Flag]], the royal flag of the [[United Kingdom]] in use since 1801 |- | [[File:Union flag 1606 (Kings Colors).svg|100px]] || 1763â1801 || Flag hoisted in most military installations in Quebec and later for both Upper Canada and Lower Canada |- | [[File:Pavillon royal de France.svg|100px]] || 1715â1763 || Used in New France; Standard of the royal family of France until 1789 |- | [[File:Pavillon LouisXIV.svg|100px]] || 1663â1715 || Used in New France? Standard of King Louis XIV |} ===Vice-regal flags=== {{Expand list|date=September 2010}} {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse;" |- bgcolor="#efefef" ! width="110"|Flag!!width="100"|Date!!width="250"|Use!!width="250"|Description |- | [[File:Flag of Canadian Governor General LeBlanc.svg|100px]] || 1999â2002 || Flag of the Governor General || Modification ordered by the then Governor General of Canada, [[RomÃ©o LeBlanc|The Right Honourable RomÃ©o LeBlanc]]. The tongue and the claws were removed to have a more polite look. Replaced by previous flag |- | [[File:Standard of the Canadian Governor General 1931.svg|100px]] || 1952â1981 || Flag of the Governor General || A lion standing on a St. Edward's crown, with the name "Canada" below; replaced 1931 flag |- | [[File:Canada-GG-1931.svg|100px]] || 1931â1952 || Flag of the Governor General || A lion standing on an Imperial/Tudor crown, with the name "Canada" below; replaced by 1952 flag |- | [[File:Flag of the Lieutenant Governor of Ontario (1959-1965).svg|100px]] || 1959â1965 || Flag of the Lieutenant Governor of Ontario{{cite web |url=http://www.crwflags.com/fotw/flags/ca_grlnd.html |title=The Maple Leaf Garland |author=David Prothero |date=December 4, 1999 |work=Flags of the World |publisher= |accessdate=April 1, 2011}} || Reverted to a Union Jack with provincial badge 1965â1981 |} ===Military flags=== {{Expand list|date=September 2010}} {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse;" |- bgcolor="#efefef" ! width="110"|Flag!!width="100"|Date!!width="250"|Use!!width="250"|Description |- | [[File:Naval Ensign of the United Kingdom.svg|100px]] || [[Royal Canadian Navy|RCN]]- 1911-1965 [[Royal Canadian Sea Cadets|RCSCC]]- 1905-1965 || Used as the ensign of both the [[Royal Canadian Navy]] and used by the some [[Royal Canadian Sea Cadets]] squadrons. Generally used throughout the entire British Empire by the British Navy and still lingered on even after many commonwealths became independent and gained their own Navies. || [[St George's Cross]] with the Union Flag in the canton. |- | [[File:Canadian Blue Ensign 1921.svg|100px]] || [[Royal Canadian Navy|RCN]]- 1921â1957 [[Royal Canadian Sea Cadets|RCSCC]]- 1929-1953 || The Blue Ensign, worn as a jack by the [[Royal Canadian Navy]] and used by the [[Royal Canadian Sea Cadets|RCSCC]]|| [[Blue Ensign]] defaced with the [[Royal Arms of Canada]]. The maple leaves at the bottom of the shield are green. |- | [[File:Canadian Blue Ensign.svg|100px]] || 1957â1965|| Final version of the Blue Ensign, worn as a jack by the [[Royal Canadian Navy]] ||[[Blue Ensign]] defaced with the [[Royal Arms of Canada]]. The maple leaves at the bottom of the shield are red. |- | [[File:Royal Canadian Air Force Ensign (1941-1968).svg|100px]]|| 1941â1965|| Based [[Royal Air Force Ensign]], as used by the [[Royal Canadian Air Force]]|| A field of air force blue with the Union Flag in the canton and the Canadian roundel in the middle of the fly. |- |[[File:King's Colour of Royal Military College of Canada.jpg|100px]]|| â1965|| Based King's Colour, as used by the [[Royal Military College of Canada]]|| King's Colour of the Royal Military College of Canada with the Union Flag. |- |} ==Others/Non-official flags== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse;" |- bgcolor="#efefef" ! width="110"|Flag!!width="100"|Date!!width="250"|Use!!width="250"|Description |- | [[File:Canada Pearson Pennant 1964.svg|100px]] || 1965 || Proposed Flag for Canada, known as the ''Pearson Pennant'' || A blue field with a white square containing a three-leaf maple. The blue sides were meant to represent [[John A. Macdonald]]'s description of the [[Canadian Pacific Railway]] and Canada's geography, "From sea to sea". |- |[[File:Flag of Vancouver Island.svg|100px]] || 1988 || Flag of [[Vancouver Island]] || A Blue Ensign defaced with the great seal of the Colony of Vancouver Island. Used informally today.[http://www.crwflags.com/fotw/flags/ca-bc-vi.html FOTW Flags of the World: Vancouver Island (British Colony, Canada)] This unofficial flag was designed in the 1980s to retroactively represent the colony (1849â1866). In 1865 permission was given from the Crown to colonies to place their badges on the fly of the Blue Ensign and as such could be argued by vexicologists that this could be an official flag.[http://www.fraser.cc/FlagsCan/Provinces/BC.html Flags of Canada: British Columbia] |- | [[File:Canadian Duality Flag.svg|100px]] || 1994 || Proposed flag for Canada, known as the ''[[Canadian Unity Flag]]'' || Blue stripes added to the current flag. |} ==University flags== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse;" |- bgcolor="#efefef" ! width="110"|Flag!!width="100"|Date!!width="250"|Use!!width="250"|Description |- | [[File:Flag of Queens University (Canada).svg|100px]] || 1884 || [[Queen's University]] || |} ==Corporate flags== A number of private corporations also use their own flags, but they are often used along side the Maple Leaf. A list of corporations with corporate flags: * [[CIBC]] * [[Sheraton Hotels]] * [[Royal Bank of Canada|RBC]] * [[Toronto Maple Leafs]] * [[Hudson's Bay Company|HBC]] ==See also== * [[Canadian royal symbols]] * [[Flags of the Lieutenant Governors of Canada]] * [[List of Canadian provincial and territorial symbols]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Flags of Canada}} * [http://www.flags.net/country.php?country=CANA§ion=CURR&category=NATL World Flag Database] * [http://www.pch.gc.ca/progs/cpsc-ccsp/sc-cs/df1_e.cfm Canadian Government Homepage- The National Flag of Canada] * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/ca_sk_fr.html Fransaskois on Flags of The World] * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/ca_mb_fr.html Franco-Manitobains on Flags of The World] * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/ca_bc_fr.html Franco-Columbians on Flags of The World] * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/ca_yk_fr.html Franco-Yukonnais on Flags of The World] * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/ca-bc-vi.html Monarchist League of Canada on Flags of The World] * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/ca_ab_fr.html Franco-Albertans on Flags of The World] * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/ca_nu_fr.html Franco-Nunavois on Flags of The World] * [http://flagspot.net/flags/ca-1837l.html Flags used in 1837-39 in Lower Canada] {{Template group|list= {{Canadian flags|state=collapsed}} {{Canada topics}} {{Lists of flags}} }} {{DEFAULTSORT:List Of Canadian Flags}} [[Category:Lists of flags|Canada]] [[Category:Flags of Canada| ]] [[Category:Canada-related lists|Flags]] [[de:Liste kanadischer Flaggen]] [[fr:Liste des drapeaux canadiens]] [[gl:Bandeiras do CanadÃ¡]] [[it:Bandiere delle province e territori del Canada]] [[he:×××¨×××ª ×××× ×§× ××]] [[nl:Lijst van vlaggen van Canada]] [[ja:ã«ããã®æä¸è¦§]] [[pt:Anexo:Bandeiras das provÃ­ncias e territÃ³rios do CanadÃ¡]] [[th:à¸à¸à¹à¸à¸à¸£à¸°à¹à¸à¸¨à¹à¸à¸à¸²à¸à¸²]] [[zh:å æ¿å¤§æå¹åè¡¨]]
